intro: Allium fetisowii, commonly known as the Tibetan leek, is a species of flowering plant native to the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems and clusters of small, white or pale purple flowers. The plant produces bulbous structures similar to onions, which are often used in traditional medicine and local cuisines. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Allium fetisowii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in mountainous regions.
